HARD.description: A classic Sichuan street food featuring chewy noodles tossed in a spicy, savory, and nutty sauce, often topped with minced pork.
triviaClues: The name translates to 'carrying pole noodles', referring to the street vendors who once sold them from poles.
The dish is known for its complex flavor profile: spicy, savory, nutty, and numbing.
It is traditionally served with minimal broth, more like a saucy noodle dish.

dishOptions.name: Lo Mein
dishOptions.reason: Lo Mein are Cantonese stir-fried noodles, which are typically less spicy and have a different flavor profile.

dishOptions.name: Ramen
dishOptions.reason: Ramen is a Japanese noodle soup, which is a different culinary tradition and dish structure.

dishOptions.name: Biang Biang Noodles
dishOptions.reason: Biang Biang Noodles are hand-ripped wide noodles, often served with a simple chili oil and garlic sauce, but they are from Shaanxi province and typically lack the complex sauce.

dishOptions.name: Zha Jiang Mian
dishOptions.reason: Zha Jiang Mian is a Chinese noodle dish with a rich fermented soybean paste sauce, lacking the spicy and numbing qualities of the target dish.

dishOptions.name: Sichuan Cold Noodle Salad
dishOptions.reason: While also Sichuanese and spicy, this is a cold dish with a lighter, often nutty dressing, not the warm, rich sauce with minced pork.

HARD.description: A South African fast food dish consisting of a hollowed-out loaf of bread filled with a spicy curry.
triviaClues: It originated among Indian migrant workers in Durban, South Africa.
The dish is typically eaten with hands, tearing off pieces of the bread to scoop up the curry.
It is commonly available with various curry fillings, including lamb, chicken, or bean.

dishOptions.name: Poutine
dishOptions.reason: Poutine is a Canadian dish of fries, cheese curds, and gravy, unrelated to a bread-filled curry.

dishOptions.name: Boerewors Roll
dishOptions.reason: This is a South African sausage served in a bread roll, which is a type of hot dog, not a curry dish.

dishOptions.name: Roti Curry
dishOptions.reason: Roti Curry involves a flatbread served alongside a curry, not a curry served inside a hollowed bread loaf.

dishOptions.name: Vetkoek
dishOptions.reason: Vetkoek is a South African fried dough bread, often filled with mince, but it's a different type of bread and filling compared to the curry-filled loaf.

dishOptions.name: Kottu Roti
dishOptions.reason: Kottu Roti is a Sri Lankan dish of chopped flatbread stir-fried with vegetables and meat, not a curry served in a bread loaf.

triviaClues: This dish was originally prepared by herdsmen (gulyÃ¡s in Hungarian) in cauldrons over an open fire.
The quality and quantity of the main spice are crucial to its authentic flavor.
It is often considered both a soup and a stew, depending on its consistency.

dishOptions.name: Paprikash
dishOptions.reason: Paprikash is a stew, often with chicken or veal, characterized by a creamy, sour cream-enriched sauce, not the clear broth of the target dish.

HARD.description: A popular spicy noodle soup with a rich, coconut milk-based broth, often topped with seafood, chicken, and fresh herbs.
triviaClues: This dish is a fusion of Chinese and Malay culinary influences.
The broth is typically made from a complex rempah (spice paste).
It is a popular breakfast, lunch, or dinner item across Malaysia and Singapore.

dishOptions.reason: Ramen is a Japanese noodle soup with various broths and toppings, but it is not a Southeast Asian coconut-based curry soup.

dishOptions.name: Pho
dishOptions.reason: Pho is a Vietnamese noodle soup with a clear, aromatic beef or chicken broth, very different from a spicy coconut curry broth.

dishOptions.name: Mee Goreng
dishOptions.reason: Mee Goreng is a Malaysian stir-fried noodle dish, not a soup.

dishOptions.name: Asam Laksa
dishOptions.reason: Asam Laksa has a sour, fish-based broth without coconut milk, tasting distinctly different from the creamy, spicy target dish.

dishOptions.name: Tom Yum Soup
dishOptions.reason: Tom Yum is a Thai hot and sour soup, characterized by lemongrass, kaffir lime, and galangal, but it is not a coconut-based curry noodle soup.
